intro: Cabralea selloi, commonly known as the Sello's cabralea, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at moderate elevations. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
